page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY OF BANBRIDGE 1
page.content: Banbridge is situated in the townland of Ballyvalley which in Irish means "the townland of the road". The earliest reference to Banbridge is in 1691 and the stone bridge over the Bann was built in 1712. The growth of Banbridge was largely due to the linen industry. The farmers in the area grew flax and at first the industry was domestic. However, in the nineteenth century a number of large mills and factories were built along the River Bann and Banbridge became a major centre for the linen industry.
